result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerry R. Fredrick Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full from bond posted

Supervision fees
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

Calling 14cf60 and 15cf03. Arendt/Michlig/Court in receipt of PSI report - Arendt statement to uncharged read-in  -  Rachel Diver statement - Michlig/Arendt/Court statement to sentencing.

Michlig states there is an independent investigation pending involving the death of Joseph Potvine - Search Warrant return rec'd this morning - has not had time to review.  The investigation has been completed - proposal submitted to Erickson yesterday - adjournment requested.  Erickson requests adjournment to review search warrant results and discuss proposal with defendant.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
